column4: why are you still running 10.10? If it's because of Unity, you could always try 11.04, Natty Narwhal, the last version before that used Gnome 2 and not Unity
yea i dont like Unity at all so I never upgraded
so try 11.04, it uses Gnome 2, not Unity
I just patch things that I need to. And build myself new kernels as time goes on.
I'll think about it. I was pretty sure it was on Unity though.
actually, it has both Unity and Gnome 2
So its not Unity with the session fallback crap?
oh ok
try it on a VM or something
yea Ill make a VM on my Windows desktop and check it out, its usually what i do with most releases these days
yea its LTS so it should be supported still
not that i care that much, if i really have to patch something i can just build it most of the time.
all .04 's are LTS
yea i forgot lol.
in that case ill just stick to my 10.10
not a issue really
yea its not LTS. They support for 3 years not 5. The 10.04 ends on the day of the release of 13.04
from 12.04 LTS description: " While it lacks some new features, it will receive guaranteed support for five years from April 2012"
ah I see. Man being stuck on 12.04 for 5 years LOL
5 years of unity would mean that person would be dead xD
I'm thinking of using 12.04 LTS with Cinnamon instead of Unity. It's made by the makers of Linux Mint because they liked Gnome 2
